modules.description: Provides functions to extract modules with specific type constraints from a given structure, enabling typed access to key and hash operations. Works with polymorphic types wrapped in a container, allowing for flexible integration with Irmin's type system. Used to create typed views of data for storage and retrieval in versioned data stores.

Adds a string key with an optional boolean default to a hash store, using a module implementing the Irmin.Hash.S signature. Retrieves values by key from the hash store. Provides a command-line term for interacting with the hash state in CLI applications.

Adds a named content module with an optional default flag, enabling storage and retrieval of content objects. Operates on string keys and modules conforming to the Irmin.Contents.S signature. Used to register and access content types in a version control system's data store.

Encapsulates type-safe operations for interacting with versioned data stores by defining constraints on key and hash types. Supports polymorphic data through containerized abstractions, enabling precise control over storage semantics. Allows creation of typed interfaces for key manipulation and data retrieval. Enables structured access to Irmin-compatible stores with custom hash functions and type enforcement.

Adds a key-value store with hash-based lookups, content storage, and type-safe access to versioned data. Supports string keys, content objects, and custom hash types, enabling precise data manipulation and retrieval. Users can register content types, query stored values, and interact with the store via CLI commands. Provides structured access to Irmin-compatible systems with enforced type constraints and polymorphic data handling.

Provides versioned storage and retrieval of custom data types with support for branching, merging, and conflict resolution. Operates on structured data such as trees, logs, and graphs, enabling automated tracking of changes in distributed systems. Used to manage state in unikernel applications, synchronize data across microservices, and implement real-time dataflow pipelines.

Provides a key-value store with hash-based access, supporting string keys, content objects, and custom hash types for versioned data. Enables type-safe queries, content registration, and CLI-driven interactions with structured data. Users can retrieve and manipulate stored values using command-line tools. Examples include storing and fetching versioned files, managing custom data types, and querying content by hash.
